channel.title: NYT > Business > Economy
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 The New York Times Company

item.title: Jobs Report Could Provide Overdue Clarity on Uncertain Economy
item.description: Hiring and unemployment data for November will offer a snapshot of a cooling job market buffeted by President Trump’s policies.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Davis O’Brien

item.title: Trump’s Nvidia Chip Deal Reverses Decades of Technology Restrictions
item.description: President Trump’s decision to allow Nvidia to sell its chips to China has raised questions about whether he is prioritizing short-term economic gain over long-term American security interests.
item.dc:creator: David E. Sanger

item.title: U.S.-U.K. Trade Deal Hits Stumbling Block
item.description: The U.S. government has paused a tech-focused trade pledge with Britain over broader disagreements about Britain’s digital regulations and food safety rules.
item.dc:creator: Eshe Nelson and Ana Swanson

item.title: Trump’s $100,000 H-1B Fee Faces Lawsuit
item.description: California and New York are among the states arguing that the Trump administration’s decision to charge that fee for skilled foreign workers is illegal.
item.dc:creator: Francesca Regalado

item.title: Businesses Are Cashing In on Trump’s Tax Cuts
item.description: Corporate tax revenue has quickly dipped since Republicans passed tax cuts this summer. But economists think these tax breaks might be worth it.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Duehren

item.title: Cooling Labor Market and Elevated Inflation Stoke Fed Divisions on Rate Cuts
item.description: Fed officials explained their opposition to the central bank’s decision this week to cut interest rates by a quarter of a percentage point.
item.dc:creator: Colby Smith

item.title: Trump’s Tariffs Shrank the U.S. Trade Deficit in September
item.description: The monthly trade deficit fell to its lowest level in five years after the president’s imposition of sweeping global tariffs. But it’s unclear whether the trend will persist.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson

item.title: Trump Doesn’t Want to Talk About Affordability. Democrats Say That’s a Gift.
item.description: The president continues to brush off an issue that he said he would solve in his first months in office. Some Democrats say he is making the same mistake as his predecessor.
item.dc:creator: Erica L. Green

item.title: The Fed Cut Rates Again but Deep Divisions Cloud Path Ahead
item.description: The central bank’s decision to lower interest rates for a third straight meeting was highly contentious, reflecting an internal divide that will likely limit how much borrowing costs will fall next year.
item.dc:creator: Colby Smith

item.title: Trump Defends Tariffs Amid Growing Concerns Over Affordability
item.description: The president rolled out a $12 billion bailout for farmers as he makes the case that his policy is working — or will soon.
item.dc:creator: David E. Sanger

item.title: Why the A.I. Boom Is Unlike the Dot-Com Boom
item.description: Silicon Valley is again betting everything on a new technology. But the mania is not a reboot of the late-1990s frenzy.
item.dc:creator: David Streitfeld

item.title: Powell Faces Pressure From Multiple Fronts as Fed Prepares to Cut Rates
item.description: The chair of the central bank is dealing with internal divisions while being besieged by President Trump and front-runners jockeying to replace him.
item.dc:creator: Colby Smith

item.title: Have Trump’s Tariffs Gone as High as They Can Go? Businesses Hope So
item.description: A wave of companies are petitioning for exemptions from the Trump administration’s high levies on foreign-made goods, saying they are hurting business and raising prices.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson

item.title: Groups Express Anixety as Trump Threatens to Derail U.S.-Mexico-Canada Trade Pact
item.description: Hearings that began Wednesday in Washington reflected anxiety over the future of the U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade pact and whether the president could end up scrapping it.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson

item.title: Higher Prices, Less Coverage: Your Stories of the Home Insurance Crunch
item.description: Readers told us how insurers are raising premiums and, in some cases, cutting back coverage, as climate change shakes up the real estate market.
item.dc:creator: Claire Brown

item.title: Nature Retracts Study Predicting Catastrophic Climate Toll
item.description: While growing evidence shows that carbon emissions are harming the economy, the journal Nature found that an outlier paper had deep flaws.
item.dc:creator: Lydia DePillis

item.title: Zillow Removes Climate Risk Scores From Home Listings
item.description: The scores aimed to predict a property’s risk from fires, floods and storms, but some in the real estate industry as well as homeowners have called them inaccurate.
item.dc:creator: Claire Brown

item.title: U.S. Black Friday Sales Defy Tariffs and Economic Woes
item.description: Data on spending this week shows that consumers are shopping big for the holidays despite inflation and economic worries.
item.dc:creator: Kailyn Rhone

item.title: U.K. Budget Plan Calms Markets and Labour Faithful. Will It Appeal to Voters?
item.description: The plan presented by the chancellor of the Exchequer, Rachel Reeves, called for spending increases and higher taxes on the wealthy and the middle class.
item.dc:creator: Mark Landler

item.title: Market Volatility Underscores Epic Buildup of Global Risk
item.description: Some experts see a dangerous combination of factors reminiscent of practices that led to previous financial crises.
item.dc:creator: Patricia Cohen
